text:
Ro: Hey guys, it’s Ro! Welcome to another
Nerdy Nummies! Today I have a

Ro: very special guest, it’s Jen! Jen: Hi
guys!

Ro: She is amazing! I love this gal! I’ll
put her links down below, you

Ro: can go check out her channel, and go say
hi to her on all of

Ro: her social medias! Jen: Social, yeah!
Ro: Yeah!

Ro: If you may have guessed, we are dressed
up as witches today because

Ro: it is the season, Halloween season, it
is my favorite season!

Ro: And I got so many requests from you guys
to make something
Ro: Hocus Pocus themed! Jen: Yes!

Ro: And I love this movie! This is one of
my favorite movies, have you seen it?

Jen: I love it! It’s my favorite Halloween
movie! Ro: Me too!

Jen: We’re like twins! Ro: We’re like
twinsing, right now!

Ro: We’re, we’re like, we have the same
shoe size you guys!

Ro: So today, we’re gonna be making Hocus
Pocus Spellbook Cookies!
Ro: Are you ready? Both: Let’s get started!

Ro: The things you’ll need will be: 3 cups
of flour, 3/4 cup of almond meal,

Ro: 1-1/2 cup of sugar plus 1 tablespoon of
sugar, I’m keeping them separate,

Ro: I’ll show you why later. 1/2 a teaspoon
of nutmeg, 1 teaspoon of baking

Ro: powder, a pinch of salt, 1/2 a teaspoon
of almond extract,

Ro: 1-1/2 teaspoons of vanilla extract, 2
eggs, 2 sh-ticks of butter
Ro: or 1 cup of butter. You will also need…

Jen: A hand mixer, 2 mixing bowls, a rectangle
cookie cutter, a rolling pin,

Jen: and baking sheets lined with parchment
paper.
Ro: Now let’s put it all together!

Ro: The first thing that we’re gonna do
is combine all of our dry ingredients

Ro: to our first mixing bowl. I am gonna be
adding our flour, pinch of salt,

Ro: and here is where we add the small amount
of sugar that we talked about

Ro: earlier. Boop! And then Jen, I’m gonna
have you add the almond meal,

Ro: dump it in there. The baking powder and
the nutmeg!
Ro: Bubble, bubble, toil and trouble!

Ro: And let’s mix it together on a low speed
until everything is well combined!
Ro: This witch knows what she’s doing!

Ro: Now we’re gonna set this off to the
side and we’re going to bring in
Ro: our other ingredients.

Jen: So now we’re gonna cream together our
butter and our sugar!

Ro: And I’ve left it out at room temperature,
so it’s really soft.

Ro: You don’t want to cream it together
while it’s cold.

Ro: Boom! Jen: Boom! Ro: Alright, and now
we’re just gonna mix it up a little
Ro: bit and slowly add our sugar.

Ro: Now our butter and sugar is creamed together
and now we’re gonna

Ro: add our eggs one at a time while we’re
mixing.

Ro: So Jen, will you get on the mixer? Jen:
I got it! Ro: OK!

Ro: And I will add the egg while you’re
mixing… Boom!

Jen: And now we’re going to add our extracts,
and mix ‘em up!

Ro: Yep, and I’m gonna be doing the mixing
this time!

Ro: She’s doing the pouring, that’s what
you call teamwork on Halloween!
Ro: Boom! I put a spell on you!

Ro: Now we got our wet mixture and our dry
mixture, and we’re gonna add it
Ro: together, about 1/3 at a time.
Ro: Oh-yeah, oh-yeah, oh-yeah!

Ro: I’m sorry! I keep bumping you with my
hat!

Ro: Now that we’ve made our dough, we’re
gonna divide it into 2 sections,

Ro: wrap it up tight in some cling wrap and
pop it in the fridge for about

Ro: one hour. Jen: Or 1 watching of Hocus
Pocus! Ro: Huh! Yes!

Ro: Now our cookie dough has had plenty of
time to chill, and now we’re

Ro: gonna roll it out. So you’re gonna take
a little pinch of flour,
Ro: sprinkle it over the surface, so that our cookie dough won't stick, then you’re gonna take your rolling pin
Ro: and just roll it out flat.

Jen: Alright, so now we have our rectangle
cookie cutter. Ro: Mmmhmmm.

Jen: And you’re just gonna cut out as many
rectangles as you can!
Ro: And then peel off the excess dough.

Ro: We’ve got our cookies cut out, and now
we’re gonna bake them in the oven

Ro: at 350 degrees for about 12 minutes, or
until they start to turn a little

Ro: lightly golden brown color. And while
they’re baking we’re gonna roll

Ro: out the rest of our dough and make some
more cookies!
Jen: OK, our cookies are all baked! Ro: Mmmhmm!

Jen: We gave them plenty of time to cool,
what are we doing now Ro?

Ro: Mmmmm! Now is my favorite time! It is
time to decorate!

Ro: So what I put here is royal icing in two
little plastic baggies. Jen: Fancy!

Ro: And I put a little number 2 tip at the
end of each of ‘em, just to give

Ro: us a little bit more control. You don’t
need to do this, this is totally

Ro: optional, you can just use a ziplock baggie.
You said you’ve done that

Ro: before decorating cookies. Jen: That is
the only way I have done it before!

Ro: Right on girl, and it works! This is just
to give us a little bit more

Ro: control. So, are you ready? Jen: I’m
ready!

Ro: OK, so, we’re gonna first outline our cookie,
going all the way around

Ro: the rectangle. Now you’re gonna flood
your cookie, which basically
Ro: means you just fill it in.

Ro: Once you’ve put a lot of icing on top,
you’ll see that it’s kind of sticking

Ro: together and flooding, but to help it
you’re gonna take a toothpick
Ro: and just slowly move it around.

Ro: After you flood the cookie and the icing
is still wet, now we’re gonna

Ro: take a white M&M, and make sure the M&M
is face down so you just see

Ro: the white part. This is gonna be the eyeball
of the spellbook.

Ro: Our cookies have sat out and hardened.
Now you can pick ‘em up, you can

Ro: actually touch them, look at that! Completely
dry and now we are gonna
Ro: add on some more details!

Ro: If you haven’t seen the movie Hocus
Pocus, the spellbook in the movie

Ro: that the Sanderson Sisters use for all
of their spells and potions,

Ro: his name is Book, and he’s got a bunch
of stitching on the front and he’s

Ro: got an eyeball, and he’s got a personality
all of his own!

Ro: So we’re gonna be taking the brown icing
again and we’re gonna be making

Ro: the patchwork, all the stitches. So I’m
gonna be doing some squiggly

Ro: lines, and then he’s got a little tear
right here.

Ro: To add some finer details, what we’re
gonna do is switch the tip,

Ro: so right now we have a number 2 tip, and
we’re gonna switch the tip
Ro: to be a number 1 so it’s even smaller.

Ro: And we’re gonna use the number 1 tip
to ice on little eyelids.

Jen: I was just thinking these look like little
eyelashes.
Ro: Huuuuh! We could make a girl book!
Ro: And, I’m going to!  Jen: We should make a girl book. Ro: I'm gonna make a girl one! You know what, I’m gonna give her

Ro: little eyelashes. No, oh shoot, you know what
Jen, could you help me here?
Ro: Just…. Thanks!
Jen: Oh!

Ro: The next color that we’re gonna be decorating
with is a gray royal

Ro: icing, we’ve got 2 bags over here. And
this one is a little bit more

Ro: liquid-y and this one is a little bit
more firm.

Ro: And it’s really easy to firm up your
royal icing, all you have to do

Ro: is add a little bit more powdered sugar.
And if you’d like your

Ro: royal icing a little bit more wet, flood-y,
you will add a little bit of water.

Ro: So in this bag we have a little bit more
water. In Jen’s bag, a little

Ro: bit more firm, so a little bit more powdered
sugar.

Ro: So the first thing is I’m taking the
more liquid-y one,

Ro: and I’m just gonna ice the corners of
the book.

Ro: And you’re gonna make a long rectangle
down this side of the book.

Ro: This is just a little binding detail,
on the spellbook he’s got some cool

Ro: deets. Now, we’re gonna take the thicker
gray icing and  we're gonna frost on

Ro: some details. The spellbook, in each corner
of the book, it has a snake

Ro: design. Put a little dot for the eye and
then down the binding, one more snake.

Ro: You guys can skip this step if you want,
because it already looks

Ro: like a spellbook, I just wanted to add
some fancy details.

Jen: For the final touch we’re going
to add just a dab of black royal icing.

Ro: Mmmhmmm. Jen: To the center of the eyeball.
Ro: Mmhmm.

Jen: Like a little pupil. Ro: Oh a little
pupil!
Both: Ta-da!

Ro: Here are our Hocus Pocus themed Spellbook
Cookies!

Ro: A big thank you to you guys for suggesting
these! And, a thank you to Jen!

Jen: Aw! Thanks! Ro: My girl over here who
helped me bake today.
Ro: You did amazing!

Jen: Oh thank you so much for having me on!
This was so much fun.

Ro: Thanks for helping me make these. I think
Jen did so well with decorating

Ro: because she’s got a real steady hand,
a true artist!

Ro: I’ll be putting her links down below, once again
so go check her out, say hi!

Ro: Give her a tweet. Jen: Yeah! Ro: Yeah!
Jen: Tweet, tweet!

Ro: And, speaking of tweets, if you guys make
these cookies, please take a picture

Ro: and send it to us! We would love to see
it!

Ro: I love seeing your baking creations, I
just get a big kick out of it!
Jen: I love it so much! Ro: It makes my day!

Ro: And, if you guys have any other ideas
for any other Nerdy Nummies,

Ro: please let me know, leave me a comment
down below and I will do my
Ro: best to make it happen.

Ro: Alright, thanks again you guys, bye-bye!
Jen: Bye!
